item.title: Airbus soars to strong 2024 profits, driven by a surge in aircraft deliveries
item.description: Commercial aircraft deliveries rose by 4.2 percent to 766, helping revenues climb by six percent to 69.2 billion euros.

item.title: Mercedes to cut costs by 10% as profits dip amid a plunge in EV sales. ‘We are taking steps to make the company leaner, faster and stronger’ says CEO
item.description: The fading fortunes of the auto sector have become symbolic of a broader malaise affecting Europe's struggling top economy—a key battleground ahead of...

item.title: CEOs unhappy with Trump on Ukraine
item.description: Also: Ford cuts manager bonuses, Is Ackman the new Buffett?

item.title: Trump shot himself in the foot with tariff plan if he wants an interest rate cut, Fed minutes show
item.description: President Trump is ploughing ahead with his tariff plans and threats, while still pushing for a cut to interest rates.

item.title: Trump’s DOJ can’t rewrite the law on DEI. Here’s why companies shouldn’t back down
item.description: Do not fall into the trap: A presidential executive order cannot nullify federal or state law.
